# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Sure, here's how you can do this in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(words::Vector{String}, text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = String[]
    curr_line = ""

    for word in words
        if length(curr_line * " $word") > text_width
            push!(lines, curr_line)
            curr_line = ""
        end
        curr_line *= " $word"
    end

    # Add the remaining line if any
    if !isempty(curr_line)
        push!(lines, curr_line)
    end

    join(lines, '\n')
end

# Example usage:
words = ["Lorem", "ipsum", "dolor", "sit", "amet"]
print(wrap_string(words))
```
This will wrap the string with words into multiple lines based on `text_width` argument. If you want to use the default value of 10 for `text_width`, you can simply call the function without passing `text_width`.
